fields.description:
When configuring the Watching Portlet with a "Number of Issues" Value of "-1" the portlet (placed on the users Dashboard) causes an exception (see below)
The user can't use his dashboard (or JIRA).
To access the Dashboard again the user has to link directly to the Manage Portal page and remove the faulty configuration.
The user's intent was to show all watched issues and not only a limited amount of watches
I think the "Number of Issues" value should be checked if it's valid when creating the portlet..

java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: fromIndex(0) > toIndex(-1)

fields.summary: Can not post comments to (closed) Hibernate Jira issue

fields.description:
Any one of my coleagues can create filters in our version of JIRA and share them to other users. This is used intensively in our projects.

Normally the users share the filter with a given project group. It would be nice, if it was possible to hide some of those filters. I'm added to many groups and therefore i see A LOT of filters on my dashboard that aren't relevant for me. I cannot remove those filters in any way.

Suggestion: Add a Show / Hide option on the Manage Filters page (per filter) where i can Hide all the vieweable filters that are not relevant for me.
fields.summary: Filters should be hideable

fields.description:
Please see attached screenshots.

As you can see, the comments are not the same height with and without WIKI enabled. I know it's a small issue, but with many comment and WIKI enabled, the page tend to get very long without any reason.
fields.summary: Comments do not have the same height with and without WIKI

fields.description:
Please see the attached screenshot. The "Permlink" text is not translated.

You should use the "viewissue.permlink" property from JiraWebActionSupport.
fields.summary: Permlink not translated in e-mails

fields.description: After upgrading to 3.6.2 i can no longer enter a summary in the Quick Sub-Task Creation form (the field is very small).
fields.summary: Width of text box for creating sub-tasks messed up

fields.description:
The "<< Hide" and "Show >>" text used for the collapsible fields are not translatable as far as i see.

You should use the "common.words.hide" property from JiraWebActionSupport.
fields.summary: Hide/Show text for collapsible fields are not translated

fields.description: We just upgraded to version 3.6.2 of JIRA, and now all of the images in the HTML e-mails are broken. instead of
fields.summary: img links in HTML e-mails are broken

fields.description:
Reports via    "Full Content --->  Word"   produces incorrect results.
(a) it does not include the "Description" field
(b) if only ever includes one item only (even if you have filtered 15 items)
fields.summary: Reports via "Full Content --->  Does not include Description Field

fields.description:
When performing a reporting function via  "Full Content -->  HTML"  the filed  "Description"  is not included in teh report.
This is a bug since "Full Content" by definition means everything.
fields.summary: Missing "Description" field when performing a "Full Content --> HTML" report
Improve rendering of image-less HTML notifications in Outlook

fields.description: Currently the only fields that are displayed in the quick create screen are the subtask description, type, assignee, priority and status. It would be nice to be able to customise this (e.g. we'd like to show the issue code as well).
fields.summary: Provide the ability to configure what fields are displayed on the subtask quick create form

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-10280].
  {panel}

This improvement relates to the default pale yellow colour that JIRA uses to highlight every other colour in a table of many rows.
The current pale yellow colour that JIRA uses by default is OK on some screens but on many other screens it is too pale to be distinct compared to the default "white" colour that is used for every other row.

=====================
PROPOSED SOLUTION:
=====================
Look & Feel > Colours > add another user choice called "Every Other Row Colour".
This would be useful because this colour needs to be user configurable.
The current pale yellow colour that JIRA uses by default is OK on some screens but on many other screens it is too pale to be visually different compared to the default "white" colour that is used for every other row.
Therefore, would be great if the user could specify the colour used for "Every Other Row Colour"
fields.summary: Add another colour user option under:    "Look & Feel"   >   "Colours"  >  "Every Other Row Colour"

fields.description:
The linker plugin gets JavaScript errors in IE.
Will need to fix it.
fields.summary: Linker plugin does not work in IE

fields.description:
STEP 1:   Filter against a user in JIRA
STEP 2:   17 issues are displayed
STEP 3:   you decide to generate a more detailed view of the 17 issues via "Full Content --> HTML"
STEP 4:   you get the more detailed view BUT instead of 17 issues you only see 13 issues.  For some unknown reason, 4 issues have gone missing!!!!
fields.summary: Missing items when using "Full Content --> HTML"

	at com.atlassian.johnson.filters.JohnsonFilter.doFilter(JohnsonFilter.java:91)

	at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationFilterChain.doFilter(ApplicationFilterChain.java:173)

	at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationFilterChain.internalDoFilter(ApplicationFilterChain.java:202)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationFilterChain.doFilter(ApplicationFilterChain.java:173)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardWrapperValve.invoke(StandardWrapperValve.java:213)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardContextValve.invoke(StandardContextValve.java:178)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardHostValve.invoke(StandardHostValve.java:126)
	at org.apache.catalina.valves.ErrorReportValve.invoke(ErrorReportValve.java:105)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardEngineValve.invoke(StandardEngineValve.java:107)
	at org.apache.catalina.connector.CoyoteAdapter.service(CoyoteAdapter.java:148)
	at org.apache.coyote.http11.Http11Processor.process(Http11Processor.java:856)
	at org.apache.coyote.http11.Http11Protocol$Http11ConnectionHandler.processConnection(Http11Protocol.java:744)
	at org.apache.tomcat.util.net.PoolTcpEndpoint.processSocket(PoolTcpEndpoint.java:527)
	at org.apache.tomcat.util.net.LeaderFollowerWorkerThread.runIt(LeaderFollowerWorkerThread.java:80)
	at org.apache.tomcat.util.threads.ThreadPool$ControlRunnable.run(ThreadPool.java:684)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:552)

To reproduce this, create a custom field for project A, create a custom field for project B, create 2 issues, one in each project. Stick the custom field onto the Resolve issue screen. Try to Bulk Resolve both issues. Or try to Bulk Edit them.

The actual code that determines whether a custom field is avaialble for Bulk Edit uses searching code (i.e. the same code that is used to find out whether to display the custom field in issue navigator for searching). There is a bug in it which actually also causes JRA-10237

As far as I can tell the bug is in getReleventConfig(SearchContext searchContext) method in CustomFieldImpl. As the method loops over custom field and retrieves relevantConfig for each search context, if relevantConfig is not null for the first searchContext in the loop, but is null for any of the following search contexts, the custom field is shown anyway. I believe that iif the custom field is not applicable for at least one searchContext then it should not be avaialble.

There are several problem there:

1. I do not think we should rely on searching code when doing bulk operations. Feels wrong to me. Need to decide if we need to completely create a new method for this.
2. Even if the searching code is used, the code loops through all the unique project id, issue type id combinations. This is not great, as if you have 2 issues, bug from project A, and task from project B, the code will loop through 4 cobninations, but really needs to check only 2.

For Bulk Workflow the problem is similar. See the availableForBulkEdit(BulkEditBean bulkEditBean) method on CustomFieldImpl, it also loops over configs and if relevantConfig for an issue is null, the field is shown anyway.

Hopefully this expalanation will make more sense once you have a look at the code.
fields.summary: Custom field is displayed during Bulk Edit and Bulk Transition when it does not have a context for some of the issues.

fields.description:
Hi Support,

I would like to prevent comments being added to an issue that has been closed, preferably for a group of users, but all would be fine as well.  It seems that if the permissions scheme allows people to add comments to an issue, then this extends to when the issue is closed.

Is there a way this can be done?

Thanks,

Rowan.
fields.summary: Disallow comments being added to closed issues.

fields.description:
For example,

Anton's event will appear as event.type.antonsevent.name on view notification scheme page and on view workflow transition page.
fields.summary: If a custom event type has an apostrophe in its name it appears as a text key
When entering comments, bugs, etc, the sequence @text@ will display a textbox in the middle of the users comment or issue

fields.description:
When restoring JIRA from XML backup, the SOAP cache of project versions doesn't seem to be flushed.

I have an XML backup containing a test project with two versions, "Product Backlog" and "Sprint 1".  A version "Sprint 2" is created, and SOAP used to fetch the versions.  I then restore JIRA from XML backup, so the web interface shows the two versions "Product Backlog" and "Sprint 1".  However, fetching the versions with SOAP will continue to return "Product Backlog", "Sprint 1" and "Sprint 2" until I restart the application server.

I'm using this approach to unit test a SOAP client I'm writing.
fields.summary: "Restore Data from XML" doesn't seem to flush SOAP cache

fields.description: Seems we forgot to close an HTML comment tag.
fields.summary: Description is not shown in full content view of Issue Navigator

fields.description:
Currently tasks such as workflow customization, screen schema and permission schema are done at administration level. This means that as we have a number of project groups we either have to allow a member of each project group to be an admin, or set up a dedicated administration team to do these tasks. 

The first option has resulted in global setting being changed, causing problems for some projects.

The second option is costly.

By creating a project administrator, who could be the project leader and allowing him to undertake some of these tasks without needing jira-administrator rights would solve this problem. If the project leader could also set up user groups within his own project, that would also allow complete isolation of a project if needed.
fields.summary: Make administration more fine grained so some admin tasks can be moved to project administrator

fields.description:
It would be nice to be able to configure the sorting of files and screenshots using a property in jira-application.properties; something along the lines of: jira.subtask.quickcreateform.fields

Some fields to sort on would be: 
*doc name
*file size
*file date
fields.summary: Allow custom sorting of attachments and screenshots in jira-application.properties
Allow for editing of image and file attachment names
Symmetric links

fields.description: When a user tried to create an issue with 0 bytes or corrupted attachment, issue is created without attachment(without any warning).
fields.summary: Warning message when an issue is created with 0 bytes or corrupted file

fields.description: When indexing an issue, it retreives all sub tasks to index only the id of them.  Pointless as we retrieve the subtasks by their id...
fields.summary: Indexing the subtasks is inefficient
Obtain value of  CheckBox from PluginFunction

fields.description:
We recently switched on Wiki style rendering, and the tab order is driving me nuts.  Basically, the Preview and Help icons for fields that Render Wiki appear after the text area for them, but in the tab order are before the control.  I use tab a lot, and its a little odd for the order to go right to left.

I can recreate it on this site on this page as I edit.  Put the focus in the Environment TextArea for a CreateIssue screen, then hit Tab...It should go to the Wiki icon for Environment, then the Help Icon, then the Description.  Instead, it goes to the Help Icon for Descrption, then Wiki icon for description, then Description.

The reason this is especially painful is Description is the first Wiki enabled text area in our System.  So I can tab through everything as I would expect, and hit the unexpected when I hit Description, which is the last item I'm filling in (I then Use the Alt-S to finish logging).
fields.summary: Preview and Help icons should be after Description in Tab Order on a page in IE

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-10247].
  {panel}

When you hover over a link from on the Issue page it shows you info about the link.

If there is a description that is included in the text (generated using the title html tag)

Would be nice if showed the date of the release if that data is available.

Sorry if this is a dupe
fields.summary: Title tag on Version link to include date information

fields.description:
entry of date 0.jul.06 doesnt result in error. 
JIRA interprets this date as 30.jun.06
This is only an example. It seems, that all date with day 0 result in the last day of the predecessor month.
fields.summary: entry of date 0.jul.06 doesnt result in error

fields.description:
Greetings from Berlin, Germany!

Our JIRA-Deployment contains 4 "Projects" which have the *same* "Version"-Structure and Release/Rollout-Dates.
Currently, in order to have an Overview of Issues _mapped_ to a certain "Version", we have to open each "Project"-Overview (Roadmap) separetely and check the involved Issues per "Project"....

It is currently not possible, to have an immediate and full *Overview* concerning *all* the Issues scheduled to a certain *"Version"* across multiple _Projects_ sharing the same "Versions"-Structure. 
This is a big Handycap for our Workflow, as we have to open 4 _Roadmaps_ of 4 different _Projects_ in order to make a Statement concerning the Status of a onstanding (or already released) *Version*. 

Moreover, the _Issue Navigator_ does not allow us to search/filter for "Fix Version" across *all* _Projects_ - this is only possible for one _Project_ at a time...

The lack of this "Feature" makes our daily JIRA-Work cumbersome, and it would be great if you could/would implement the Possibilty to fetch the "Version"-Information across multiple _Projects_ as well as a possibility to search/filter for _Versions_ across multiple _Projects_ in *Issue Navigator* as soon as possible...

Thanx in Advance,

Cheers,

Alexander
fields.summary: Ability to filter/view Issues upon "Versions" across multiple "Projects"

fields.description: We are currently introducing a new Issue Type Scheme to our projects. This includes that the new scheme has less sub-task-types than the previous scheme. While the Main-Issue types will get correctly updated the sub-task-types won't. A workaround would be great for as quick solution...
fields.summary: Issue Type Scheme Migration does not update subtasks

fields.description: We need to move to a proper object instead of passing the GenericValue around everywhere.
fields.summary: Create a project object and factory to wrap the project GenericValue

fields.description:
Currently, there are many places where we have a plugin system, but don't necessarily use it.

There are also many web components that we could create that can be reused on different pages (and simplify the action hierachy significantly).
fields.summary: Refactor JIRA to use plugin system, and create more components

fields.description:
An accidential trailing space in a user's email address will cause CreateOrCommentHandler to fail.

The error message is:
"The mail 'FROM' does not match a valid user
 This user is not in jira so can not add a comment: "-censored-" <-censored-@-censored-.edu>"

So "example@host.com" doesn't equal "example@host.com " which is technically true but maybe a trim() would weed out this error since it can be easily overlooked.

However, sending email to the user with the space works.
fields.summary: CreateOrCommentHandler fails when user's email address has trailing spaces.

fields.description: We have defined a lot of Steps in Jira for a complex workflow. When try to import data from csv-file via csv import wizard into a project which is linked with this workflow the import breaks with message  "Status 'xxx' does not have a liked step in the 'jira' workflow". Inthis example xxx stands for a defined step in our workflow. the workflow 'jira' is NOT linked to the project.
fields.summary: Importing from csv-file throws error: Status 'xxx' does not have a liked step in the 'jira' workflow

fields.description:
I have created 2 customfields, each one belonging to a specific project.
When I perform a search on those 2 projects, I can see the 2 customfields in the search form.
The problem is that if I select a value for customfield number 1, the search returns results in the project number 1 only. I have no results for the project number 2.
In addition, if I select a value for Customfield number 1 and a value for Customfield number 2, I have 0 result. 

IMHO:

When selecting multiple projects, customfields not being configured for the context (ie available for the 2 projects) shouldn't be visible in the search form.

OR

When performing the search, Jira should search results with a "OR" condition whereas a "AND" condition: search issues in project 1, project2 where customfield1=value or customfield2=value
In this case, we will have results.

Thanks,
Cécile
fields.summary: Customfields belonging to specific projects are shown when those projects are selected
Captcha for anonymous bug report or comment

fields.description:
A single user in our org. cant login with her LDAP credentials while all other users can. 
we can't recreate her because she reported a bunch of issues. how do we reset her authentication method?
fields.summary: LDAP Auth not working for one user
CSV importer should only list valid statuses if a project is selected

fields.description:
A Regex with multiple groupings can cause descriptions and comments to cahnge:

Eg.

With {{jira.projectkey.pattern = ([A-Z]([A-Z]|[0-9])+)}} the following can happen:

{{29DEB932-7983-1000-A514-C0A878320001}} becomes
{{29DEB9322-7983-1000-A514-C0A878320001}} (extra digit "2" before hyphen)

An extra "2" before the hyphen

The below examples also illustrate the problem:

{{ABCDEE-7}} becomes {{ABCDEE-7}} (no problem in this case)
{{2BCDEE-7}} becomes {{2BCDEE-7}} (no problem in this case)
{{2A21-7}} becomes  {{A211-7}} (extra "1" before hyphen)
{{A22-7}} becomes {{A222-7}} (extra "2" before hyphen) 
{{A1-7}} becomes {{A11-7}} (extra "1" before hyphen) 
{{A-7}} becomes {{A-7}} (no problem in this case)

It is caused by the extra groups.
This shouldn't change data though, the above regex can be written as {{jira.projectkey.pattern = ([A-Z][A-Z0-9]+)}} and will perform correctly.
fields.summary: Project Key Regex can change data

fields.description:
When using external authentication and changing the password, it is then impossible to log in with FireFox (ver. 1.0.7).

To reproduce:
* We are using LDAP authentication.
* User has 'Remember my log in' set.
* User changes their Windows password, and then after logging on tries to access Jira, but is confronted with the attached screen (as would be expected). 
* On clicking 'Log In', user is not taken to the new Log in screen, but instead left on the same dashboard - although the URL does change to: http://jira.cs.navman.com/jira/secure/Dashboard.jspa?os_destination=%2Fsecure%2FDashboard.jspa 

Effectively it is now impossible for the user to log on using FireFox.
fields.summary: Unable to log in with FireFox after changing (external) password
Set Assignee to Group

fields.description:
Jira gives an error when starting Tomcat. The start of Jira is aborted. It is not possible to use jira.

I have attached the atlassian-jira.log, localhost_log.2006-05-21.txt and catalina.out.
Tomcat also runs Confluence. This runs runs fine.
fields.summary: Cannot load condition class: com.atlassian.jira.workflow.function.issue.UpdateIssueStatusFunction
Attachments are lost if there any error while opening a bug

fields.description: A member of our team had a hard time understanding why JIRA cannot resolve the host name he provided, until he finally noticed that he accidentally added a space after the host name. This was hard to notice in the error message during sending test email due to the proportional font used in browser.
fields.summary: Spaces in SMTP host should be trimmed before resolving the host
Create issue should be an item in the issue change history
Time stamp in RSS feed are the same for all news

fields.description:
Need to create a web filter that cleans the thread local that is used by transaction code to hold the database connection during a transaction. The web filter needs to log warnings when it finds the thread lcoal uncleared. The same thread lcoal clearing code needs to to be put into the service runner.

Also need to fix up org.ofbiz.core.entity.TransactionUtil, such that the thread lcoal is cleared in the finally block (just in case).

Remember that no JIRA class should interact with org.ofbiz.core.entity.TransactionUtil directly. JIRA's classes should call methods on com.atlassian.core.ofbiz.util.CoreTransactionUtil, which should in turn proxy calls to org.ofbiz.core.entity.TransactionUtil.
fields.summary: Ensure transaction thread local gets cleared for every request and service run (potential deadlock fix)
Document the contents of the velocity context for release notes

fields.description:
This happens if:

- the e-mail has attachments
- attachments are enabled in the system
- the creation of attachments fails with an exception (e.g. disk full, or pemissions on the directory are incorrect)
- the forward feature of the mail service is *not* enabled

The solution to this problem should be very similar as the one done for the linked issue. Only this time the CreateIssueHandler needs to be fixed.
fields.summary: An issue could be created from the same e-mail message over and over if creation of attachments fails with an exception
Remove calls to web actions in ExternalUtils for creating constants

fields.description:
Participants field can take a long time to index.

Should use some Charting plugin _magic_ to retreive list of participants quicker.
(Check out Scott's code)
fields.summary: Participants Custom Field slows reindex

fields.description:
The date picker is not working for dates prior to 1970.
We use the date picker to manage several issue fields that do require the use of dates prior to 1970. The work around that is in place is to use a small text field but naturally the prefered method will be to use the date picker to enable better search functionality.
fields.summary: Handling of dates prior to 1970

fields.description: currently, when conducting a search in the 'Quick Search' field, the results will only turn up whole words.  Would be nice to have the ability to search on partials (contains) in this field.  For instance, a search for "Smith" would not produce tickets related to "Smithson" in the 'Summary' field.
fields.summary: Ability to conduct 'Contains' search in quick Search
CustomFieldManager: getCustomFieldObjects passes issue ID rather than project ID

fields.description: This is related to JRA-10213. Once this is done we should be able to remove the hack that was put in place to resolve that issue. I have left this a bit open-ended since there are a number of ways to solve this issue. The end result should be that a custom field can look at the IssueContext of where it will be moved and at its current location and determine if its values will need to be updated for a correct move to occur.
fields.summary: CustomFieldType API needs to allow for a "needsMove" type method

fields.description: At the moment the CustomFieldType API does not allow for a proper needsMove method so in the case of a version custom field (where the versions will be different per project) we have no way of specifying that the custom field needs to prompt the user for new values.
fields.summary: Version custom fields will munge their data when going through a move or bulk move

fields.description: The values in external-link.properties are modified by JIRA distributors. To ensure that the tests pass when distributors build JIRA, we should fetch the value of external.link.jira.support.mail.to from external-links.properties file rather than hardcode teh value.
fields.summary: TestUpgradeTask_Build56 should fetch the e-mail address from external-link.properties rather than hard code the value

fields.description: If you add a Two Dimensional Filter Statistic to the default dashboard, it will start showing up on the jira login page even before user logins in -- albeit it will be empty.  Please see screen shots of what this looks like and how our two dimensional filter portlet is set up.
fields.summary: Allow specification of permissions on porlets

fields.description:
When you clone a task, the new one is properlly located at the beginning of the workflow assigned to the project, however the asignee remains the one in the original task. If you have defined a Default Asignee in the project properties; the task should be assigned to him and is not.

This makes the clone function completelly unusable for us; as the project lead will not be able to move the issue forward in the workflow as is not the asignee
fields.summary: Clone does not respect  "Defaul Asignee"  definition for a project

fields.description: It would make administration so much easier if the project leads/admin had the ability to add users to the project.
fields.summary: Project lead should have ability to add users to project

fields.description:
We've got a "closed" JIRA system (in other words, people cannot register themselves; we gotta do that) and as we're also using Confluence, the info e-mail that's sent to newly created users does not carry sufficient information for them.

It basically says: "This is your login data for our JIRA". But we should be able to tell them: "This is your login data for our JIRA, our Confluence, and you can contact our support via this e-mail address." Is it possible to make that info e-mail customizable?
fields.summary: Info mail for new users should be customizable
Remove I'm feeling luck from quick search as no-one uses it, and it causes problems on IE 7

fields.description:
In our Wiki help, we misspell 'monospaced':

{noformat}wiki.renderer.help.text.effects.monspaced=monspaced{noformat}
fields.summary: 'Monspaced' spelling error in Wiki help

fields.description:
If a user has a filter involving due date, eg. issue due after 17/May/06, in an old version of JIRA (so far I've tested 3.0.3) and then upgrades JIRA (to 3.6.1), the filter no longer returns the correct results after the upgrade.

In the database's 'searchrequest' table, you can see that JIRA is still using the old filter format:

{code:xml}
<searchrequest name='Test due date filter'>
  <parameter class='com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.parameters.lucene.ProjectParameter'>
    <projid name='projid' value='10000'/>
  </parameter>
  <parameter class='com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.parameters.lucene.DateParameter'>
    <duedateAfter name='duedateAfter' value='2006-05-17 00:00:00.0' operator='>=' timestamp='1147788000000'/>
  </parameter>
  <sort class='com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.SearchSort'>
    <searchSort field='issuekey' order='DESC'/>
  </sort>
</searchrequest>  
{code}

*Note:* This _only_ affects JIRA *Professional*, not Enterprise.
fields.summary: Filters (saved searches) with due date not valid after upgrading JIRA Professional

fields.description: If we are performing an Edit, Workflow Transition, Bulk Edit, or Bulk Workflow Transition then we need to validate the the selected issue type does not resolve to a different workflow or field configuration scheme than the issues original issue type. There is already a check for this in the code that generates the correct options for issue types and there are func tests for this. To be on the extra safe side we should validate the values before we store them. This is difficult to implement until JRA-10200 is fixed.
fields.summary: The validateParams of the IssueTypeSystemField should have an extra check for some bulk operations

fields.description: If you look at the method getIssueOperation in the BulkEditBean you will find that it is trying to get the issue operation with the operations name, but that the map caching the issue operations is caching by issue operation name key. This results in a null issue operation being returned for all operation other than the bulk workflow transition.
fields.summary: The bulkEditBean getIssueOperation is broken for all operations other than the WorkflowTransition operation

fields.description: This should be a simple change. You just need to modify the moveissue.jsp to check prof instead of enterprise. We should then make sure that wizard is showing you that you are changing the issue type (if you are). I think at the moment something is stopping the wizard from showing this.
fields.summary: Need to make move issue in Professional edition show the issue type since we allow issue type schemes in Pro

fields.description:
I added some statuses in administration page.
One of them has a single quotation mark in its name. like this: *U-Closed(can't fix)*

This single quotation mark caused error and below error log was printed in log file.
I changed *U-Closed(can't fix)* to *U-Closed(cannot fix)* so that error resolved.
But I think that this error needs to be fixed. :) 
thank you.

fields.description:
To take advantage of the -Dorg.apache.jasper.runtime.BodyContentImpl.LIMIT_BUFFER=true flag (for JRA-10145), we need to upgrade Tomcat.  Since Confluence use Tomcat 5.5.15, that seems like a good target.

Release notes show that this flag was not added until 5.5.15 anyhow:

  http://tomcat.apache.org/tomcat-5.5-doc/changelog.html
fields.summary: Upgrade JIRA standalone version to Tomcat 5.5.15 (synch with Confluence and for reuse buffers option)

fields.description:
Eg. see:

http://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEANUTILS-204?page=all

When the issue was edited and Reporter changed, the Bugzilla id field was apparently deleted (it wasn't actually).
fields.summary: Bugzilla Id custom field still appears to be deleted in change history

fields.description:
Mandatory field would be better if it has a default value that not one of the available value, therefore user must enter a desired value before proceeding to the next step.

When closing JIRA issue, sometime the Resolution is not 'Fixed'. JIRA assigned this by default and most of the time user forgot to change this default value. As a result user has to reopen and assign a new value for another closing.

Similarly to the Affected and Fix version fields. Apparently the administrator always wants some values in these fields, therefore it would be good to make it mandatory to avoid a 'none' value.
fields.summary: Improvement suggestion on handling the mandatory field

fields.description: When creating multiple users, it would be useful to have a add new user button in the user screen that is displayed right after a user creation so that you can just go on creating another user without having to go through the User Browser to add user
fields.summary: Add new user button after creating a new user link in the User Screen
Project issue type scheme via SOAP
Add possibility to use letters instead of icons of type of issue, priorities and status

fields.description:
In my company, many users want the multiple choice option in 'Comment viewable by' field.
I think it is useful too.
fields.summary: In 'Comment viewable by' field, multiple choice option needs.

fields.description: When an incorrect default value is entered and submitted, the page returns back but no error message is displayed and the input field is missing, therefore preventing the user from correcting the value and leaving him with the only option that is submitting an emty value.
fields.summary: Invalid values entered in the User and Multi-User custom fields default values screen removes input box and does not display error

fields.description: When creating a JIRA attachment have it automatically create / store in Confluence - This a feature request of 1 of our resellers Stephen Danelutii of Netociety
fields.summary: When creating a JIRA attachment have it automatically create / store in Confluence

fields.description:
I would like to have a custom field in which a selection from a primary field (Field 1) determines whether a second field (Field 2) should be shown or hidden.  

Example:  I have a select box (Field 1) with several options, including the catch-all "other".  If the user selects "other", I'd like to show a text box (Field 2) where they can enter a description.  If "other" is not selected, I'd rather not bother the user with a vestigial  place-holder text field.

This is similar to the 'cascading select' custom field in which the properties of Field 2 are determined by the selection in Field 1.  However, additional field types should be available to "cascade to" for Field 2, and a show/hide-cascading-field property defined for each Field 1 option.

Thanks!
Derek
fields.summary: show or hide a second field based on selection in a primary field

fields.description: Now that we have entered Data Collection fields and placed a data collection custom field on the resolve screen, the custom field produces change history entried for the issues when they are resolved.
fields.summary: Message custom field produces change history entries
Update docs to mention that the drop down list restricting comment and work log view only contains user's groups

fields.description:
At the moment all Users that are in the AssignTo list of the project are shown even if there is a security level active that does not allow the user to see this issue.

e.g.
Group1 with User1
Group2 with User2

AssignTo for porject allowed to Group1 & Group2

Issue has Security Level that allows onyl Group1 to see the issue -> In every workflow transition i get User1 and User2 in the selection.
The user can't see this issue so it makes no sense to assign it to him.
fields.summary: AssignTo shows user that are not in security level

fields.description:
It would be very handy to have chance add some suser's fields to project details. These field are linked to project mainly and have nothing to do with issue workflow.
Please see the screenshot where the user field should be possible to add.
fields.summary: More project's details needed - possibility to add custom fields

fields.description: Person who adds attachment must be able to remove it .
fields.summary: Remove attachments -permission to person who added it

fields.description: Possibility to add component specific permissions
fields.summary: Permission schemes to project components
Improve concurrency handling in JIRA

fields.description:
To re-produce:
1. Create a Custom Field of Type Multi Check Box
- associate it to one or more issue types but *not* All Issue Types
- associate to All Projects or Single Project 

2. Create a filter on the above: 
- All Projects or Single Project
- at least one issue type associated with the Multi Check Box Custom Field
- check at least one value for the Multi Check Box Custom Field

3. Add 2D Filter Statistics to dashboard, use saved filter, add Custom Field to any axis

4. Portlet displays with the following:

An error occurred whilst rendering this message. Please contact the administrators, and inform them of this bug. java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:585) at org.apache.velocity.util.introspection.UberspectImpl$VelMethodImpl.invoke(UberspectImpl.java:267) at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTMethod.execute(ASTMethod.java:197) at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTReference.execute(ASTReference.java:175) at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTReference.value(ASTReference.java:327) at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTExpression.value(ASTExpression.java:51) at *Note** If the Multi Check Box Custom Field is configured for *All Issue Types* then the portlet does not show this error
fields.summary: NullPointerException in 2D Filter Statistics Portlet if Multi-Checkbox Custom Field is associated to specific issue types
Change Sub-Task Numbering to link it back to the Parent Task

fields.description: If you try and bulk edit issues, Jira will allow you to edit the issue typem even though the workflows for the types are different. This causes major workflow issues that can only be resolved by editing the database directly.
fields.summary: Bulk Edit allows you to edit issue type even if the workflows are different

fields.description:
I've just upgraded from 3.4.2 to 3.6.1. Most things work fine. However when IssueEvents are fired (created , updated ,assigned, resolved, closed, commented, reopened, deleted, moved, worklogged, workstarted, workstopped, genericevent), IllegalArgumentException is thrown by these three listeners: IssueIndexListener, IssueCacheListner and MailListener and logged in catalina.out as follows:

2006-05-15 15:40:19,468 ERROR [jira.event.issue.IssueEventDispatcher] Exception thrown from listener [com.atlassian.jira.event.listeners.search.IssueIndexList
ener] : No event type with id 9
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: No event type with id 9


2006-05-15 15:40:19,470 ERROR [jira.event.issue.IssueEventDispatcher] Exception thrown from listener [com.atlassian.jira.event.listeners.mail.MailListener] :
No event type with id 9
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: No event type with id 9


2006-05-15 15:40:19,471 ERROR [jira.event.issue.IssueEventDispatcher] Exception thrown from listener [com.atlassian.jira.event.listeners.cache.IssueCacheListe
ner] : No event type with id 9
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: No event type with id 9

        at com.atlassian.jira.event.type.DefaultEventTypeManager.getEventType(DefaultEventTypeManager.java:100)
        at com.atlassian.jira.event.issue.AbstractIssueEventListener.workflowEvent(AbstractIssueEventListener.java:91)
        at com.atlassian.jira.event.issue.IssueEventDispatcher.dispatchEvent(IssueEventDispatcher.java:105)
        at com.atlassian.jira.event.issue.IssueEventDispatcher.dispatchEvent(IssueEventDispatcher.java:80)
        at com.atlassian.jira.event.issue.IssueEventDispatcher.dispatchEvent(IssueEventDispatcher.java:67)
        at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.issue.MoveIssueConfirm.issueUpdate(MoveIssueConfirm.java:265)
        at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.issue.MoveIssueConfirm.doExecute(MoveIssueConfirm.java:224)
        at webwork.action.ActionSupport.execute(ActionSupport.java:153)
        at com.atlassian.jira.action.JiraActionSupport.execute(JiraActionSupport.java:58)
        at webwork.dispatcher.GenericDispatcher.executeAction(GenericDispatcher.java:132)
.
.
.
Is this a bug with jira in this release?
fields.summary: IssueEvent causes IllegalArgumentException to be thrown: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: No event type with id X

fields.description:
Both Firefox and Outlook do not display images within HTML emails by default. In this way, HTML emails are not correctly formatted - in particular, the left-side summary column is very wide in Outlook.

It is necessary to click the "Accept download of images" button in order for the email to be displayed and formatted correctly.
fields.summary: Mail notification not formatted correctly until the 'Accept download of images' option is selected

fields.description: Can it be possible to have 7.5 hour days - my organisation (and I suspect we aren't alone) work on a 7.5 hour day.
fields.summary: Allow to specify half hours for length of day

fields.description: After signing up to a JIRA instance, the next logical thing to do is sign in. JIRA already has the entered username and password, so should log users in automatically.
fields.summary: Sign users in automatically when they sign up

fields.description:
Our users are requesting to have the ability to create a filter on all issues they are subscribed to as watchers. Is their a timeframe of when this can be available?

Thanks,
Amrita
fields.summary: Ability to create a filter on all the watched issues...

fields.description:
Developers can have a JIRA issue detail page present in their browser and click on Log Work Done to receive the log work done screen; they then fill out their information and click Submit to receive an error message stating that they do not have permission to see this issue.  

There needs to be a check when the user actually clicks on Log Work Done, in addition to, the actual form processing page, that the user still has a valid session.  It can be quite aggravating to log your work, in detail,  and then have that error appear.
fields.summary: Log Work Done does not check for current session

fields.description:
It would be nice to be able to share filters with a single person (and multiple single people), in addition to, by group.

This would be nice in helping to keep the number of groups to a manageable level and I think that this further enhance the abilities of developers (and others) in be able to coordinate views of work.
fields.summary: Allow filters to be shared singly (with a single person)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-10156].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 3rd January 2014|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Hi All,

Thanks for your votes and comments on this feature request. 

Due to resources and priorities at this time we have no immediate plans to improve our export issue to MS Word feature. We understand that this will disappoint a few of you needing this the most. If you are not using our OnDemand you might find this [commercial third party plugin|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.xpandit.plugins.jiraxporter] as a satisfactory work around.  

While we will not be addressing this particular feature request in the near future, we plan to resolve several other requests as we have done in our past releases.

Thanks for your patience and we hope you appreciate our open approach to feature requests.

Cheers,
Roy Krishna
JIRA Product Management
roy (at) atlassian (dot) com
{panel}
*Original request description:*

When an issue with an image attached is exported to Word, the image doesn't show up in the Word document.
Tried with a JPG attachment, not other formats.
Opening the exported document in Word 2003 and OpenOffice.org 2.0 both results in a document without images, only the /images/icons/attach/image.gif placeholder + filename is shown.
They aren't even hyperlinked
fields.summary: Export issue to Word doesn't export images
